meanings.definition: A person or thing that cancels or annuls something.
meanings.sent1: The cancellers of the event made sure everything was stopped.
meanings.sent2: The school had to hire new cancellers after the old ones retired.
meanings.sent3: The cancellers at the party were the rain clouds that ruined the outdoor celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her persuasive arguments acted as cancellers, nullifying any doubts in their minds.
meanings.sent5: The cancellers, like erasers on a pencil, wiped away any mistakes.

meanings.sent1: The cancellers gathered to discuss their plans for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: She bought new cancellers for her collection of office supplies.
meanings.sent3: The cancellers in the drawer were all different colors, making it easy to find the right one.
meanings.sent4: The cancellers stood out in the crowd, each one unique in its design.
meanings.sent5: The cancellers on the shelf were neatly arranged, ready to be used when needed.
